title: Bayes Factor Theorem
contentHtml:
The Bayes factor theorem is a fundamental result in Bayesian hypothesis testing.

Given two models, we can calculate the Bayes factor as the ratio of posterior odds to prior odds.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves calculating the posterior probabilities under each model and then taking the ratio.

intuition: The Bayes factor theorem provides a way to quantify the relative evidence for one hypothesis over another, given some data.
realWorldApplications: Evaluating competing theories in scientific research
